This game, when I initially joined, was a ton of fun with a good premise: Play as a killer or survivor. But, the core mechanics always make this frustrating for both sides. I'll explain why:

Hitboxes. Many of the hitboxes are ludicrous, from Huntress throwing refridgerators, to hits through pallets, to pallet stun hit detection... they make the game frustrating for both sides.

Balance. Heavily skewed towards survivors, who have a total of 8 second chance perks, and 3 boon totems which you would be hard pressed not to run, since they counter hex totems, including the newest which restores broken totems: Pentimento.

Map Design. This goes back to Balance, but maps are heavily in survivors favor most of the time. Some are exceptions, like Shelter Woods or Azarovs, but most killers, especially 110 speed killers, cannot deal with them well.

Weak Killers. This makes it so that survivors don't have to put in a ton of effort to survive. With looping as the main source of chases, many killers are designed to counter that, with nothing else. I think the best example of this was pre-nerf deathslinger. He was great in a chase, but garbage with everything else. Behavior also actively nerf killers who displease the most vocal survivor mains without giving a proper rebalance. Case in point, Deathslinger. He was able to instascope and shoot, with a slightly smaller Terror radius. They increased the Aim Down Sight and TR... but didn't give him anything to compensate for that. Many killers can't be used because they are not viable against the slew of second chances the survivors will throw at you during the match.

The Meta. Most survivors stick to some version of the meta: Three second chance perks (Unbreakable, Decisive Strike, Borrowed Time, Adrenaline, Iron Will, Inner Healing, Any Boon totem, most likely circle of healing), and one exhaustion perk to extend chases (Dead Hard, Sprint Burst, Balanced Landing, Lithe, Head On... etc.). Since Looping for survivors is easy, many just use Dead Hard as their preferred choice, as it was buffed to ignore good timing from killers. It's the equivalent of a get out of jail free card, and is frustrating to play against when they consistantly use it.

The Bugs: Due to the poor coding skill of the devs, bahaviour is riddled with bugs and hacking possibilities. Lag-switchers, blatant hackers, DDossers, Doxers... you name it, you'll have a chance to run into them because they don't even try to fight against these. Hell, if you wanted to you could mod yourself auric cells and nobody's the wiser. This doesn't even touch on the bugs the devs add themselves. It's well known by the DBD community that every patch, behaviour adds more bugs, sometimes to seemingly irrelevant things. 
This is due to the method of coding they use, Block coding, which often creates lines of spaghetti code for them to sift through and try to fix. It's overly difficult for large projects like this. Only a massive overhaul of their existing code will concretely fix the problem, but the devs will never do this.

The Attitude of the devs. This is the biggest problem. There are three monetization methods within this game: Buying the game, Paid DLCs, and buying Auric Cells. THIS IS SCUMMY AND SHOULD BE REDICULED, BUT THE COMMUNITY DOESN"T CARE ANYMORE.
The devs also have blatant bias towards one side of the game. Often times they will add mechanics or nerfs to killers that never needed them or needed a rebalance. They added a pointless overheat mechanic for Billy and the aforementioned 'Slinger nerfs. Most decisions are for the survivor's benefit, but that is because they know that survivors are their biggest source of income. However, for me it is at the point where I can't stand playing this game anymore because of the continual changes and nerfs to one side but not the other. I remember when they started doing proper balance, but that is no longer the case.
On a side note, the DBD forum mods are really egotistical. I got banned for arguing for certain changes that they didn't agree with, and one mod even is moderator for one of the most toxic streamers in the community. They encourage toxic survivor behavior within their own game. I mean, Dwight, the poster boy of survivors, is based off of the project lead's likeness! Same with Jake and another member of their team! Their responses to genuine criticism are often ignored, and the only reason certain changes happened are due to the project lead (I refuse to use his name) going against a professional team. They don't play their game at the skill level required to make balance choices, nevermind if they even do at all!


The game, and the community surrounding it, is a mess. If it wasn't one of the few crossplay games out there, I would have left it behind long ago. All of the fun has been sucked out from it, and everyone plays too sweaty for it to even be called playing anymore.

Dead by Daylight suffers from multiple major issues, not least of which is complacency. Behaviour Interactive has spent so long in the limelight without any real competition that they no longer actually *care* about their product, they only care about how they can monetise it. This issue is only compounded by the fact that the community has almost entirely turned these problems in to a 'meme', which only serves to egg the developers on to further ignore the issues and compound them by continuing to add broken content on to an ever larger mound of broken content.

Back when the game first came out it showed a great deal of promise 'A cat-and-mouse game with horror elements and an emphasis on teamwork against a larger threat? SIGN ME UP!' however over the years it's quickly spiralled down in to a heavily monetised frustration simulator where one side is too busy b*tching about the other side's "overpowered-ness" to pay attention to the fundamental flaws at the foundation of the game.

Behaviour doesn't care about what they need to do to fix issues including, but not limited to: hitboxes, ragequitting, hacking, toxicity, connection issues, obsolete perks, overpowered perks, and broken map designs. I can only recommend that people avoid spending their money until either A.) Behaviour fixes their game, stops worrying about monetising new content and focuses on fixing their current bloated and busted content or B.) Dead by Daylight dies due to dwindling playerbase and a new cat-and-mouse style game takes the throne which has a development team that actually gives a sh*t about the product they released.

(9/03/2022- Updated wording, also here to remind everyone that these are still issues while yet another DLC is released)

So if you can't tell by my hours, I like this game a little bit. I wouldn't say too much. It's not that many hours, but this is a pretty great game. I migrated to this after Friday The 13th got boring and I would definitely say it's better. If I was told to describe this game in one word, I wouldn't be able to. Worth the purchase!

This game is literally only fun with friends in a custom lobby, because someone on the dev team decided that a Rank 1 killer vs Rank 20 survivors is fair and balanced gameplay. 

The players are toxic, the game design is more toxic, and the dev team doesn't give a shit about things being fun for the average player. 

0/10, only get it if your friends really wanna play it.

[Crucial Note] --> I've spent time playing both Survivor & Killer evenly. This is my honest feedback.

Personally I would love to recommend people play this game, but unfortunately it's riddled with bugs & toxic players. This game could be so much more. It most-certainly has potential. This game has amazing lore & art going for it, and it easily draws you in; however the state of the game's balance proves to be concerning. As you first begin your journey, you're very much immersed in your role. As Survivor, you feel like you're fearfully fighting for your life. As Killer, you feel a sense of power and bloodlust as you hunt in the fog. Though... after your first handful of matches you start to feel differently over time.

Your eyes eventually open to see the bigger picture. The game has serious balancing issues that quickly diminish your will to play. BHVR has a disappointing habit of not conversing with their community, and time & time again show carelessness & lack of determination. The roles of Killer & Survivor feel as-if they've switched places. Killers are commonly being created weaker & weaker with each chapter release, and Survivors simultaneously receive new surprisingly strong perks & advantages each patch.

I don't feel too threatened as a Survivor, and I occasionally get bored. As Killer I get to do a lot more, but at the same time I feel a sense of dread wash over me every time I play. The Killer role feels overly hindered, and it never ceases to be a stressful experience. Killers are at various disadvantages, and that particular fact very much sticks out like a sore thumb. I want to struggle & feel fear as Survivor. I want to inflict fear & chaos, and to have control as Killer. If a Killer is up against experienced-enough Survivors, the Survivors can effortlessly escape every time (Though a highly-skilled Nurse player could maybe stand a chance).

I dislike the fact that these are all common issues. I want to love this game, but it keeps proving difficult to-do so.

[Conclusion]

For now, I don't recommend this game. It can impact your mental health if you're not careful. The Devs don't show much signs of improvement. If my points aren't convincing enough to you, then feel free to play anyway. This game could be handled a lot better in my personal opinion.

Someone once said; "I think we did a pretty good job so far". I think they can do a *little* better.
